intro: Lithocardium dasycephalum, commonly known as the woolly rock heath, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and clusters of small, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. It is a member of the Proteaceae family, which includes many ornamental and ecologically important plants. Due to its unique appearance and habitat requirements, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and by enthusiasts of native flora.
